title: Problem 2146_C
statement: You are given an integer n and a binary string^{\text{∗}} s of length n.For a permutation^{\text{†}} p of length n and an integer x, we define \text{find}(x) as in the following pseudocode:function find(int x): l := 1 r := n while l <= r: let m be a random integer between l and r (inclusive) if p[m] == x return m if p[m] > x: r := m - 1 else: l := m + 1 return undefined // not foundWe call an integer x (1≤ x≤ n) stable if and only if \text{find}(x) is always not undefined and p_{\text{find}(x)}=
